intro: Iostephane madrensis, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Iostephane madrensis is adapted to thrive in dry environments, showcasing resilience to drought and heat.
